About [the Author

ONE

FELICITY]81-the author one felicity

It was a bad day even before [I]0-i picked up the scissors . Not that [I]0-i realized it . In fact , [I]0-i was feeling pretty good that morning . Sure , [I]0-i ’d just turned twenty - eight and was back [home]222-home living with [[my]0-i parents]223-my parents , but that was only temporary . Tonight at [my]0-i ten - year high school reunion , when [people]224-people asked what [I]0-i was doing with [my]0-i life , [I]0-i had a response all ready . [Me]0-i ? Oh , [I]0-i ’m [an entrepreneur]225-an entrepreneur , [I]0-i ’d say . [I]0-i started a vegetarian catering company and food blog called [The Veggie Vixen]226-the veggie vixen . [I]0-i made some of the appetizers tonight . Have [you]227-you tried the zucchini fritters ? [I]0-i was n’t in the top echelon of [lifestyle social media influencers]228-lifestyle social media influencers or anything , and [I]0-i still had a part - time job as [a sous chef]229-a sous chef , but [my]0-i follower count was growing steadily , and last night [The Veggie Vixen]82-the veggie vixen had catered [its]82-the veggie vixen first large - scale event : a wedding at [Cloverleigh Farms]2-cloverleigh farms . [[My]0-i older sister]230-my older sister [Millie]83-millie was [the event planner at [Cloverleigh]3-cloverleigh]231-the event planner at cloverleigh , and even though [the bride]232-the bride had been a bit difficult to work with during the planning — demanding a huge , high - end reception with all the frills on a bargain budget and asking why [we]233-we could n’t “ move a staircase ”[231-the event planner at cloverleigh] so [she]232-the bride could make [her]232-the bride entrance with the light hitting [her]232-the bride a certain way — [Millie]83-millie and [I]0-i had managed to put together a beautiful event for [her]232-the bride , despite torrential summer rains that necessitated a last - minute switch to an indoor ceremony and cocktail hour . [The bride]232-the bride and all [[her]232-the bride guests]235-her guests had raved about the food , flowers , and service all night . So when [I]0-i glanced at [my]0-i phone and saw the notification from Dearly Beloved ( the hottest wedding planning app out there ) that [I]0-i finally had [my]0-i first review , [I]0-i grabbed [my]0-i glasses from [my]0-i nightstand and eagerly tapped through to The Veggie Vixen ’s profile to see it .

YUCKY AND OVERPRICED ! ! ! Reviewed by [He]236-he Put A Big A * * Ring On It

[I]0-i am not a vegetarian but [I]0-i thought it would be cheaper to not serve meat at [my]0-i wedding . [I]0-i WAS WRONG . Everything was crazy expensive and tasted terrible . The cheese toasts were soggy and even the meatballs did not have meat . [I]0-i did not want ugly gross boring vegetables at [my]0-i wedding but that was exactly what [I]0-i got . If [I]0-i could , [I]0-i would give no stars . Just ew . DO NOT RECOMMEND . [I]0-i want a refund .

Then [I]0-i called [Millie]83-millie . “ Hello ? ”[83-millie] [she]83-millie said , [her]83-millie voice low and croaky , as if [she]83-millie ’d been asleep . “ [I]0-i did not serve anything soggy ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i shouted . “ What are [you]83-millie talking about ? * * *

Several minutes later , the rush faded as [I]0-i stared at [my]0-i reflection . Sad clumps of hair littered the sink . “ Oh , shit . ”[0-i] [I]0-i tried to even out the bangs but only succeeded in making them shorter and more blunt . “ Shit ! ”[0-i] The worst thing was that [I]0-i should have known better . [I]0-i ’d been stress - cutting [my]0-i hair since [I]0-i was six , since the night [I]0-i overheard the horrible thing , and it never ended well . It felt empowering for a couple minutes , but it was never worth the trouble [I]0-i got in once [grownups]265-grownups saw what [I]0-i ’d done . Although , after [[my]0-i dad]246-my dad and [Frannie]86-frannie got married , [she]86-frannie ’d sometimes sneak [me]0-i over to [the salon]267-the salon so [a professional]268-a professional could attempt to mitigate the damage before [[my]0-i dad]246-my dad saw it , and [she]86-frannie never got mad at [me]0-i . [She]86-frannie always understood . But once [I]0-i was [a teenager]270-a teenager , [I]0-i refused [her]86-frannie help — it was [my]0-i stress , [my]0-i hair , [my]0-i problem . [I]0-i wanted to handle it on [my]0-i own , and it was n’t like [I]0-i was [a beauty queen]271-a beauty queen in the first place . A funny haircut was n’t going to make much difference to [my]0-i social status — [the kids in the marching band]272-the kids in the marching band and [Chemistry Club]273-chemistry club were n’t too judgmental about outward appearances — and [my]0-i bloody noses were more embarrassing than [my]0-i uneven bangs anyway . TWO

[HUTTON]151-hutton

[I]0-i used to think [I]0-i was magic . As [a kid]336-a kid , [I]0-i honestly believed [I]0-i could control [the world]318-the world just by doing certain things . Touching [my]0-i nose as [I]0-i entered [a room]338-a room . Stepping out of bed with [my]0-i right foot first , never [my]0-i left . Refusing to ride on the left side of the back seat in [[my]0-i dad]246-my dad ’s car , only the right . This often meant [I]0-i had to race out to [the driveway]340-the driveway early in order to beat [[my]0-i big sister]341-my big sister [Allie]71-allie , who did not have magical powers no matter where [she]341-my big sister sat in [the car]342-the car , but did have an incredible knack for pushing [my]0-i buttons . If the trip involved [the highway]343-the highway , [I]0-i had to sit with [my]0-i arms crossed without saying a word until [ten cars]344-ten cars passed . If [I]0-i saw [a tractor or motorcycle]345-a tractor or motorcycle , [I]0-i had to start over . If the trip in [the car]342-the car did not involve [the highway]343-the highway , [I]0-i had to hold [my]0-i feet off the floor the entire time , or at least until [we]348-we passed two stop signs or one traffic light . By doing these rituals but never speaking of them ( or else the magic would cease to work ) , [I]0-i was ensuring that all stayed right in [[my]0-i world]349-my world , which was pretty fucking great back then . In fifth grade , [I]0-i was [one of [the most popular kids in school]351-the most popular kids in school]350-one of the most popular kids in school . [I]0-i was good at math and baseball . [I]0-i was on [student council]352-student council and in the band . [I]0-i won the paper plate award for Most Likely to Go to Space and also an Astounding Attendance certificate , because [I]0-i never missed a day of school . ( Only [I]0-i knew that was because being absent or even tardy would alter the balance of [the universe]353-the universe and possibly weaken [my]0-i powers , not because [I]0-i was never sick . ) Then a bunch of really shitty things happened , including puberty , and [my]0-i brain was completely rewired . That ’s when [I]0-i started to hate the phone . Or more specifically , the feeling of dread [I]0-i experienced when faced with being the sole focus of [someone]307-someone ’s attention on the other end of the line . [You]355-you were granted no time to think before [you]355-you had to answer questions — it was like a fastball coming straight for [your]355-you head . [You]355-you could n’t see [their]356-their reactions to anything [you]355-you said . [You]355-you had no idea how [they]356-their might be judging [you]355-you . [You]355-you had no opportunity to weigh the risk of any possible response . In contrast to a text or email , a phone conversation exposed [you]355-you completely . [I]0-i avoided [them]356-their at all costs . So when [my]0-i cell vibrated in [my]0-i back pocket as [I]0-i was about to leave [the house]250-the house , [I]0-i almost ignored it . If it mattered , [the caller]358-the caller would leave a voicemail . Then [I]0-i ’d listen to the message and decide if it actually mattered and merited a text from [me]0-i or — even better — a response from [[my]0-i assistant]359-my assistant back in [San Francisco]12-san francisco . There was n’t much that could make [me]0-i answer or make a call in real time . But when [I]0-i saw who was calling , [I]0-i took it . “ [You]151-hutton know [I]0-i hate the phone . ”[0-i] “ [I]151-hutton do , ”[151-hutton] said [Felicity]151-hutton , “ and [I]151-hutton ’m sorry . But [I]151-hutton did n’t think [I]151-hutton could convey the urgency of this matter in a text . ”[151-hutton] [I]0-i headed from [the kitchen]263-the kitchen into [the garage]361-the garage , pulling the door shut behind [me]0-i . “ Are [you]363-she okay ? Is [your]363-she nose bleeding ? ”[0-i] “ No , it ’s not that . ”[151-hutton] “ Good . The memory of that last one still haunts [me]0-i . ”[0-i] [I]0-i slid behind the wheel of [[my]0-i SUV]362-my suv , recalling the way [her]363-she nose had suddenly and violently started to bleed while [we]364-we were out for dinner one night back when [she]363-she lived in [Chicago]13-chicago six years ago . [I]0-i ’d been in [town]313-town on business , and [I]0-i ’d been looking forward to catching up with [her]363-she , since [we]364-we really had n’t seen [each other]305-each other much since going away to college — [I’d]0-i spent [my]0-i summers on campus at [M.I.T.]7-m.i.t. and [Felicity]151-hutton had spent [hers]151-hutton working for [[her]363-she family]367-her family at [Cloverleigh Farms]2-cloverleigh farms . [I]0-i knew [she]363-she ’d abandoned [her]363-she pre - med studies at [Brown]15-brown to follow [her]363-she heart and attend culinary school , but [I]0-i wondered if [she]363-she ’d changed in other ways too . Did [she]363-she still love sci - fi ? Did [she]363-she still hate thunderstorms ? Was [she]363-she still close to [[her]363-she family]367-her family ? Did [she]363-she still cut [her]363-she hair when [she]363-she was stressed ? Would things still feel easy between [us]369-us , or was [she]363-she so different that [I]0-i would n’t feel okay around [her]363-she anymore ? What if [she]363-she felt like [a stranger]370-a stranger ? Thankfully , the moment [I]0-i saw [her]363-she enter [the room]332-the room and smile at [me]0-i , [I]0-i knew everything would be fine . FIVE

FELICITY

TWELVE

[I]0-i ’m fine . Nothing ’s the matter . Everything ’s good . SIXTEEN

HUTTON

[I]0-i had n’t slept well since [we]1297-we ’d gotten back from [New York]26-new york . Then [my]0-i net worth would crumble , and [I]0-i ’d go down in history as the guy who single - handedly tanked the digital currency industry in a day . It was a lot . But there was more to it . Beneath the surface of [my]0-i anxiety was this creeping unease that somewhere [I]0-i ’d made a wrong turn with [Felicity]151-hutton . [I]0-i could n’t pinpoint the moment where things had gone off - track , [I]0-i just sensed that things were not okay . When [I]0-i did manage to fall asleep , [I]0-i had nightmares about being caught in a storm , flood waters rising all around [me]0-i . [I]0-i could hear [Felicity]151-hutton ’s voice but could n’t see [her]1298-her . [I]0-i ’d wake up sweating and shaking , unsure what it meant . Did the flood symbolize [my]0-i fear of things out of [my]0-i control ? But things were n’t out of control . [We]1299-we ’d mapped this out so carefully . [We]1299-we had a plan , and the plan made sense . [We]1299-we had a timeline and an exit strategy . [We]1299-we would n’t be caught by surprise . [No one]244-no one was going to be rejected . [Nobody]490-nobody would be hurt . That was the beauty of it . [We]1299-we ’d stay [friends]373-friends . Except . . . [I]0-i did n’t want to make an exit . [I]0-i had n’t gotten enough of [her]1298-her . [I]0-i had n’t gotten enough of the way [I]0-i felt when [we]1299-we were together . [I]0-i ’d showed [her]1298-her more of [me]0-i than [I]0-i ’d ever showed [anyone]457-anyone , and [she]1298-her accepted [me]0-i . But [I]0-i was n’t [an idiot]2407-an idiot . [I]0-i knew that would change with the pressure of a real relationship , especially long - distance . The whole reason [we]1299-we were so good together is because it was all for fun . [We]1299-we were in on a secret in a way that pitted [us]1299-we against [the world]318-the world , not one against the other . [She]1298-her ’d stop teasing [me]0-i and making [her]1298-her little witch hat and start rolling [her]1298-her eyes , sighing heavily , and thinking [I]0-i was n’t worth the hassle . * * *

When [I]0-i got back from [my]0-i run , [Felicity]151-hutton was still asleep . [I]0-i showered and dressed , then stood at the foot of the bed , watching [her]1298-her for a moment . SEVENTEEN

[FELICITY]151-hutton

TWENTY

HUTTON

* * *

TWENTY - TWO

TWENTY - THREE

FELICITY

When [I]0-i got to work Friday , [Gianni]152-gianni told [me]0-i [Winnie]89-winnie wanted to see [me]0-i . “ [She]89-winnie ’s been in [here]1710-here a couple times looking for [you]0-i , ”[152-gianni] [he]152-gianni said . “ [She]89-winnie tried calling and texting but said [you]0-i did n’t respond . ”[152-gianni] “ Yeah , [I]0-i ’m taking a break from [my]0-i social media , and it seemed easier to just take a break from [my]0-i phone altogether , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said . “ [I]0-i ’ll go see what [she]89-winnie wants . ”[0-i] [I]0-i found [Winnie]89-winnie in [the lobby]622-the lobby , directing [guests]2422-guests to [the patio]2356-the patio , where a rehearsal dinner was taking place . “ Hey , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said . “ [You]89-winnie were looking for [me]0-i ? ”[0-i] “ Yes . [Hutton]151-hutton was [here]1710-here . ”[89-winnie] [She]89-winnie beamed . “ But [I]89-winnie kept the secret . [I]89-winnie had to tape [my]89-winnie mouth shut , but [I]89-winnie kept it . ”[89-winnie] “ Today ? ”[0-i] [My]0-i voice rose . “ [He]151-hutton was here today ? ”[0-i] “ Yes . Earlier this afternoon . ”[89-winnie] “ What did [he]151-hutton want ? ”[0-i] [My]0-i heart had started to race . “ To know where to find [you]0-i . [I]89-winnie did n’t tell [him]151-hutton , ”[89-winnie] [she]89-winnie added quickly . “ But [I]89-winnie promised to give [you]0-i this . ”[89-winnie] [She]89-winnie reached into [her]89-winnie pants pocket and pulled out a small , folded square . [I]0-i took it from [her]89-winnie and unfolded it .

TWENTY - FOUR

FELICITY

ABOUT [THE AUTHOR

Melanie Harlow]66-melanie harlow likes [her]66-melanie harlow heels high , [her]66-melanie harlow martini dry , and [her]66-melanie harlow history with the naughty bits left in . [She]66-melanie harlow ’s the author of the Bellamy Creek Series , the Cloverleigh Farms Series , the One & Only series , [the After We Fall Series]64-the after we fall series , the Happy Crazy Love Series , and the Frenched Series .

[She]66-melanie harlow writes from [[her]66-melanie harlow home outside of [Detroit]65-detroit]1670-her home outside of detroit , where [she]66-melanie harlow lives with [[her]66-melanie harlow husband]2418-her husband and [two daughters]1672-two daughters . When [she]66-melanie harlow ’s not writing , [she]66-melanie harlow ’s probably got a cocktail in hand . And sometimes when [she]66-melanie harlow is .

Find [her]66-melanie harlow at www.melanieharlow.com .
